results.title: Loose Change
results.brief_description: ‘Loose Change’ is a short animated film about money and demonstrates what you can do with money. The film has various coins and dollars talking and discussing what it is like being money.

results.title: The Good, the bad and the noodley
results.brief_description: Business is booming for Ninja Noodle which means business is bad for The Grubby Gruel. After the noodle shop is raided by the town bad apple, the good Shinobi must battle against the odds to return his secret sauce to its rightful place. East meets west in a noodle-filled western caper.

results.title: George and his groaning mouth
results.brief_description: George complains so much he is disliked by everyone he meets. One day, while he’s whinging as usual, his mouth falls off. He is rushed to the doctor but even medical experts can’t help him. George has to cope with problems holding his mouth in his hand causes. Finally he realises he has to change his complaining ways and become a better person.

results.title: KnightGame
results.creator_credit: Belmont High School, Logan Bryce, Angus Latham and Ewan Breakey
results.brief_description: ‘KnightGame’ is a Medieval local multiplayer battle arena, where any stab, shield or shot could be your last. Purchase items at your base to change, strengthen and morph you and your army into fearsome warriors, then march into battle and destroy your opponent’s base to claim victory. But be wary, not all items are created equal and many will hinder you.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.creator_credit: Tessa Laing and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: ‘Survival of the Fittest’ constructs the core message that human genetics should not be altered, despite good intentions. Based on a scientific theory by Herbert Spencer that relates to how organisms evolve over time to develop desirable traits. The film explores how scientists can artificially replicate a natural process, which can lead to a negative outcome.

results.title: A Notable tree
results.brief_description: This is the story of a boab tree in Darwin, enduring the test of time, witnessing the changes that take place around it. As it ages, it becomes a monument of nature and a symbol of survival through the history of Darwin. The Adonsonia Gregorii is a bottle-shaped tree endemic to Australia. Some trees can live over one thousand years. Some refer to them as “The Tree of Life”.

results.title: Novo
results.brief_description: After a catastrophic accident, a cloned boy aboard a spaceship finds himself lost in an unknown yet familiar place. He must come to terms with the change of lifestyle and adapt to it. Along the journey he meets some new friends and helps them as best he can.

results.title: The Goal
results.brief_description: Meet Bella, a soccer obsessed ten year old. She eats, breathes and dreams soccer. There’s just one problem. She would rather eat junk food while watching a match on TV than actually play the game herself. When a freak accident occurs, everyone mistakes her for a soccer superstar. However, due to her lack of soccer skills she fails miserably. Will she change her attitude towards exercise or remain a couch potato forever?

results.title: Parents!
results.brief_description: Britannia Butwell believes her parents are embarrassing and wishes for an exchange. That is, until she meets Sandra Sandman. Could Sandra be able to change Britannia’s mind?

results.title: Stories of Rippon Lea Estate
results.brief_description:
Melbourne’s historic Rippon Lea Estate is one of the fabulous locations used in the popular ‘Miss Fisher’ television series. It has also been the venue for an exhibition of the costumes from the series.
Here, staff of the National Trust of Australia (Victoria), who manage the property, talk about its history, its use as a filming location, and the relationship between the producers of the series, the National Trust, and the enthusiastic audiences for the series who have also visited Rippon Lea and the exhibition.
